## react-utils package

## Enumerations

|  Enumeration | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [RemirrorType](./react-utils.remirrortype.md) | These are the constants used to determine whether an element is a remirror constant. |

## Interfaces

|  Interface | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [RemirrorComponentStaticProperties](./react-utils.remirrorcomponentstaticproperties.md) |  |
|  [RemirrorManagerProps](./react-utils.remirrormanagerprops.md) |  |

## Variables

|  Variable | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [addKeyToElement](./react-utils.addkeytoelement.md) | Add the specified key to an element when it is a valid react element.<!-- -->This is useful when returning an array of components because a fragment isn't sufficient. |
|  [asDefaultProps](./react-utils.asdefaultprops.md) | Utility for properly typechecking static defaultProps for a class component in react.
```ts
static defaultProps = asDefaultProps<RemirrorProps>()({
  initialContent: EMPTY_PARAGRAPH_NODE,
});

```
 |
|  [cloneElement](./react-utils.cloneelement.md) | Clones an element while also enabling the css prop on jsx elements at the same time. This is used for emotion which needs to inject the css property which React.cloneElement doesn't support. |
|  [css](./react-utils.css.md) | A css function that just returns the string. This is typically used for css syntax highlighting of plain strings in editors. |
|  [cssNoOp](./react-utils.cssnoop.md) | A noop function that mimics the css emotion call but renders no output. |
|  [getElementProps](./react-utils.getelementprops.md) | Retrieve the element props for JSX Element |
|  [isManagedRemirrorProvider](./react-utils.ismanagedremirrorprovider.md) | Checks if this is a ManagedRemirrorProvider which pulls in the manager from the context and places it's children inside the RemirrorProvider |
|  [isReactDOMElement](./react-utils.isreactdomelement.md) | Check whether a react node is a built in dom element (i.e. <code>div</code>, <code>span</code>) |
|  [isReactFragment](./react-utils.isreactfragment.md) | Checks whether the element is a react fragment |
|  [isRemirrorContextProvider](./react-utils.isremirrorcontextprovider.md) | Checks to see if this is the wrapper we've created around the RemirrorContent.Provider component.<!-- -->This is used to help determine how the Remirror component will be rendered. <code>getRootProps</code> is the main reason for this, and I'm not even sure the effort is worth it. |
|  [isRemirrorElement](./react-utils.isremirrorelement.md) | Checks if this element has a type of any RemirrorComponent |
|  [isRemirrorExtension](./react-utils.isremirrorextension.md) | Checks if this is a RemirrorExtension type. These are used to configure the extensions that determine the underlying behaviour of the editor. |
|  [isRemirrorProvider](./react-utils.isremirrorprovider.md) | Finds if this is a RemirrorProvider (which provides the RemirrorInjectedProps into the context); |
|  [isValidElement](./react-utils.isvalidelement.md) | A drop in replacement for built in React.isValidElement which accepts a test value of any type |
|  [oneChildOnly](./react-utils.onechildonly.md) | A drop in replacement for React.Children.only which provides more readable errors when the child is not a react element or undefined. |
|  [propIsFunction](./react-utils.propisfunction.md) | Will throw an error if the child provided is not a function. |
|  [uniqueClass](./react-utils.uniqueclass.md) | Utility for generating a unique class name |
